nodes.bodyText:
I think validLastDoubleValue and validLastBDValue could also be used to tell if the last floating-point value is encoded as BigDecimal or doubleinstead of setting lastBDValue to null:

validLastDoubleValue && !validLastBDValue -> last value encoded as double
!validLastDoubleValue && validLastBDValue -> last value encoded as BigDecimal
!validLastDoubleValue && !validLastBDValue -> unknown last value floating-point value
validLastDoubleValue && validLastBDValue -> cannot happen

Thus validLastDoubleValue && null == lastBDValue could be replaced by validLastDoubleValue.
Ditto, only testing validLastBDValue should be enough to be sure lastBDValue is non-null. It can be argued that the nullity check prevents a NPE though.
lastGeoXPPoint = GeoTimeSerie.NO_LOCATION; is unnecessary since validLastGeoXPPoint is set to false.
lastElevation = GeoTimeSerie.NO_ELEVATION; is unnecessary since validLastElevation is set to false.
I think setting validLastBDValue to false is clearer than setting lastBDValue to null. This change goes with the first comment.
Also sets validLastDoubleValue to false. Also goes with first comment.
Instead copy last loc/elev/values according to valid* booleans.
Added the copying of the valid* flags, but left the noDeltaMetaTimestamp forced to true by leaving the call to safeDelta as a first step
